data.title: Get Carter
data.meta_description: GET CARTER is a British crime drama, from 1971, in which a London gangster goes to Newcastle to try and identify his brother's killers.
data.text:
violence

There are scenes of strong violence, including a sequence in which a woman is made to undress at gunpoint, before a gag is placed in her mouth and she is injected with a toxic substance, and a scene in which a man waterboards a nude woman in the bathtub. Other violence includes bloody shootings and a sequence in which a man's head is smashed through a window.

sex

Explicit pornographic images are shown to a group of men. Other scenes of sex include a man engaging in phone sex with a bare-breasted woman, who writhes on a bed, while caressing herself. There is also frequent female nudity throughout the film.

sexual violence and sexual threat

There are references to a 16-year-old girl coerced into sex for a pornographic film; parts of the film are shown and depict a girl being groomed by an adult woman, forced to drink alcohol, and touched by both adult women and men. There is no strong visual detail of abuse.

There are scenes of drug misuse. There is infrequent strong language ('f**k'), accompanied by other milder terms ('bitch', 'whore', 'screwed', 'slag', 'bollocks', 'piss', 'sod', 'bloody', 'bastard', 'shit', 'Jesus', 'Christ' and 'God').
